tool.name: Recalculate FDR
tool.command: msspercolator qvality -i '$target' --decoyfn '$decoy' --feattype $feature -o qvalityout.txt #if qoptions.active --qoptions #if $qoptions.epsilon_step ***epsilon-step $qoptions.epsilon_step #end if #if $qoptions.number_of_bins ***number-of-bins $qoptions.number_of_bins #end if #if $qoptions.epsilon_cross_validation ***epsilon-cross-validation $qoptions.epsilon_cross_validation #end if #if $qoptions.reverse.value == "true" ***reverse #end if #if $qoptions.generalized.value == "true" ***generalized #end if #end if && msspercolator reassign -i '$target' -o '$targetoutput' --qvality qvalityout.txt --feattype $feature && msspercolator reassign -i '$decoy' -o '$decoyoutput' --qvality qvalityout.txt --feattype $feature

param.name: epsilon_step
param.label: qvality Epsilon step
param.help: The relative step size used as treshhold before cross validation error is calculated. A number between 0 and 1

param.name: number_of_bins
param.label: qvality Number of bins
param.help: The number of spline knots used when interpolating spline function. Default: 500

param.name: epsilon_cross_validation
param.label: qvality Epsilon cross validation
param.help: The relative crossvalidation step size used as treshhold before ending the iterations. A number between 0 and 1.

param.name: reverse
param.label: qvality Reverse
param.help: Indicating that the scoring mechanism is reversed, i.e. that low scores are better than higher scores

param.name: generalized
param.label: qvality Generalized
param.help: Generalized target decoy competition, situations where PSMs known to more frequently be incorrect are mixed in with the correct PSMs

tool.help: Recalculate q-values and PEP on percolator data for PSMs or peptides. This uses qvality to recalculate changed (e.g. filtered) percolator data statistics. Inputs and outputs are a target and a decoy dataset.
